Issues.Title: System.Runtime.InteropServices.MarshalDirectiveException pops up when executing MetaFile automation case
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

**.Net 7.0 SDK:** 7.0.100-preview.5.22227.7

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it is a regression issue, cannot repro in .Net 6.0

### Issue description

System.Runtime.InteropServices.MarshalDirectiveException
  HResult=0x80131535
  Message=Cannot marshal 'parameter # 5': Cannot marshal managed types when the runtime marshalling system is disabled.
  Source=<Cannot evaluate the exception source>
  StackTrace:
<Cannot evaluate the exception stack trace>

  This exception was originally thrown at this call stack:
    [External Code]
    WinFormsApp12.Form1.Form1() in Form1.cs
    WinFormsApp12.Program.Main() in Program.cs

### Steps to reproduce

[WinFormsApp12.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/8582038/WinFormsApp12.zip)
1. Put tested application to the C:\Test folder on test machine
2. Open that test application, build and run
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.Runtime.InteropServices.MarshalDirectiveException pops up when executing MetaFile automation case" (#7099)

Issues.Title: TreeView OverflowException
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

net6 x86

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

unknown

### Issue description

I'm hitting an OverflowException in TreeView.cs due to the cast to IntPtr on x86 (32-bit) with multiple monitors.

It looks like this is likely fixed under net7 with https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/5791 .

`User32.SendMessageW(this, User32.WM.CONTEXTMENU, Handle, (IntPtr)User32.GetMessagePos());`

The problem is that `GetMessagePos()` could return 0xFFFEFDB5 which overflows on 32-bit
```
            //var x = GetMessagePos(); // -> 0xFFFEFDB5
            uint n = 0xFFFEFDB5;
            var nn = (IntPtr)n; // throws OverflowException
```

Is it possible to get a fix for this in net6 since net7 is still 1/2 year+ away?

### Steps to reproduce

see above
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TreeView OverflowException" (#7098)

Issues.Title: Reworking the base TextPattern implementation
Issues.Body:
Fixes #7080

## Proposed changes

- Move the real implementation into derived types (`TextBoxBaseAccessibleObject` and `ComboBoxChildEditUiaProvider`) like we did for the rest patterns in `AccessibleObject.cs` (eg. ExpandCollapse pattern)
- Reduce the logic of edit fields that have TextPattern behavior, inherit them from TextBoxBaseAccessibleObject, thereby taking many members from it and reducing the size of the types, making them simpler.

The main reason for this change - ~95% of accessible objects don't implement TextPattern and they don't know about this pattern and shouldn't keep text providers that are not used. The decision is based on discussions of CF #377144 (Bug 1043396)

PS. `ToolStripTextBoxControlAccessibleObject` doesn't need to inherit `FragmentNavigate` and `FragmentRoot` from `ToolStripHostedControlAccessibleObject` because the base `ControlAccessibleObject` class do it for any ControlHost items.

## Customer Impact

- No

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- TextPattern may be broken

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- CTI
- Manual testing

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

- Using Narrator, Inspect and AI. Checked how TextPattern works for all edit controls

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .NET 7.0
- Windows 11


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7081)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Reworking the base TextPattern implementation" (#7081)

Issues.Title: TextPattern implementation needs to be refactored
Issues.Body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

At this moment AccessibleObject.cs keeps TextPattern providers for all instances.
Consider moving TextPattern to the base TextBoxBase AO and implement providers there.

### Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered

Move TextPattern implementation to derived types.

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "TextPattern implementation needs to be refactored" (#7080)

Issues.Title: Automation cases about Label/LinkLabel met an error "Object reference not set to an instance of an object"
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

**.Net 7.0 SDK:** 7.0.100-preview.5.22226.4

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it is a regression issue in recent .Net 7.0 build from main branch, cannot repro in .Net 7.0 SDK build: 7.0.100-preview.5.22220.23, it may be caused by PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/6778

### Issue description

Automation cases about Label/LinkLabel met an error "Object reference not set to an instance of an object" when executing get PreferredSize scenario

### Steps to reproduce

We cannot get a manual repro, just met it when running our internal automation case about Label/LinkLabel with get_PreferredSize scenario, get following calll stack for product code:

                <StackTrace>
                    <Frame function="GetAnchorDestination" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Layout\DockAndAnchorLayout.cs" line="165" />
                    <Frame function="LayoutAnchoredControls" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Layout\DockAndAnchorLayout.cs" line="303" />
                    <Frame function="TryCalculatePreferredSize" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Layout\DockAndAnchorLayout.cs" line="585" />
                    <Frame function="LayoutCore" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Layout\DockAndAnchorLayout.cs" line="527" />
                    <Frame function="Layout" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Layout\LayoutEngine.cs" line="44" />
                    <Frame function="OnLayout" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.cs" line="8275" />
                    <Frame function="OnLayout" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\ScrollableControl.cs" line="628" />
                    <Frame function="OnLayout" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\ContainerControl.cs" line="926" />
                    <Frame function="OnLayout" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Form.cs" line="4038" />
                    <Frame function="PerformLayout" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.cs" line="8992" />
                    <Frame function="PerformLayout" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.cs" line="8938" />
                    <Frame function="ResumeLayout" file="D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.cs" line="10108" />

Issues.Title: Uncaught exception or assertion failure: System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException for listView's setSorting test scenario
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

**.Net 7.0 SDK:** 7.0.100-preview.5.22226.4

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it is a regression issue in recent .Net 7.0 build from main branch, cannot repro in .Net 7.0 SDK build: 7.0.100-preview.5.22220.23, it may be caused by PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7029

### Issue description

Uncaught exception or assertion failure: System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException when running automation XListView case for setSorting scenario

### Steps to reproduce

We cannot get a manual repro, just met it when running our internal automation case about ListView with setSorting scenario, get following calll stack for product code:

_Uncaught exception or assertion failure: System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException
System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException: The given key '0' was not present in the dictionary.
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewNativeItemCollection.get_Item(Int32 displayIndex) in D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\ListView.ListViewNativeItemCollection.cs:line 83
   at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection.get_Item(Int32 index) in D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\ListView.ListViewItemCollection.cs:line 107
   at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.WmReflectNotify(Message& m) in D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\ListView.cs:line 6614
   at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.WndProc(Message& m) in D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\ListView.cs:line 6908
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.OnMessage(Message& m) in D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.ControlNativeWindow.cs:line 65
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m) in D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.ControlNativeWindow.cs:line 114
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, WM msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam) in D:\WinForms\Fork\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\NativeWindow.cs:line 369_

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[main] Update dependencies from dotnet/runtime" (#7082)

Issues.Title: Empty `DataGridView` has extra NotSortedAccessibleStatus
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 7.0 (latest main)

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, there is no this extra property in .NET 6.0.
Regression from https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/6498

### Issue description

Empty `DataGridView` has unexpected `NotSortedAccessibleStatus` item status:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/165031310-d6fe519e-1490-4e8d-be95-ac6f2b4c357d.png)

### Proposal
Make additional check for empty DGV (DataGridViewAccessibleObject.cs - line 279):
```cs

                        if (ColumnCount > 0 && RowCount > 0)
                        {
                            return SR.NotSortedAccessibleStatus;
                        }

                        break;
```

### Steps to reproduce

- Create .NET 7.0  app
- Add a DataGridView there without columns or rows
- Run the app and check ItemStatus property in Inspect
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Empty `DataGridView` has extra NotSortedAccessibleStatus" (#7079)

Issues.Title: `Owner` property should be cleaned to avoid memory leaks
Issues.Body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

Not all objects are cleaned after disposing of Control accessible objects because of keeping some value in `Owner`.
Needs to suggest the opportunity to null `Owner` in accessible objects to avoid memory leaks.

### Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered

The suggestion is based on #6886 comment (see description)

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`Owner` property should be cleaned to avoid memory leaks" (#7077)
